They are commonly cooked in a variety of ways, including sautéed in butter, baked in a light cream sauce, or grilled to retain their delicate flavor and texture. When fresh, they display a bright white color and a firm, tender appearance, often served on ice to maintain their freshness and visual appeal.

They are often served as appetizers or main dishes, skewered with vegetables like red bell peppers and accompanied by lemon wedges.	<>	Scallops, grilled to perfection, exhibit a glistening, caramelized surface with a light brown sear, accompanied by vibrant orange carrots on the same skewers, all served on a white plate with subtle blue floral designs.	<>	Scallops, tender and creamy, are grilled to a golden-brown perfection, with caramelized edges and a glossy sheen from a light glaze, served on a plate with other grilled items like orange-red bell peppers and soft, toasted buns.
